Articles.Content:
Hello, so recently In KSP I built a ship to launch to Duna, it was a typical ship and nothing war wrong. However, every time I try to revert flight with the ship (because I'm bad at the game) the game simply crashes. [https://www./folder/deggafgcnv0gy/KSP_Crash_File](https://www./folder/deggafgcnv0gy/KSP_Crash_File) That link contains the download for the file, can I please get some help. I can't find where to find my system information like graphics card and stuff, and if anyone would tell me where to find it, I would put it into the post too.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-19T23:52:08Z" title="07/19/2015 11:52  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 19, 2015</time> by limeindy**

Interestingly i am having exactly same problem here and its wierd.I also built a ship for duna and i cant revert flight.It crashes the game.I never experienced a game crash in ksp before.Is there any chance that we are trying to launch exactly same duna rocket? that would be a odd thing but like i said its really wierd.

Hi limeindy, your logs show that KSP could not access any memory.

> 
> KSP.exe caused an Access Violation (0xc0000005)
>  in module KSP.exe at 0023:00d95510.
> 
> Error occurred at 2015-07-18\_210414.
> 
> K:\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\KSP.exe, run by limeindy.
> 
> 47% memory in use.
> 
> 0 MB physical memory [0 MB free].
> 
> 0 MB paging file [0 MB free].
> 
> 0 MB user address space [1679 MB free].
> 
> Read from location 00000138 caused an access violation.

Please try setting all your graphics options to their minimum and reverting to launch again, if it works you may want to try the active texture management addon.
Thanks I'll try that, the only this is that it's not even taking up 2GB's of RAM, and I have 12 available. But thanks for the advice, I'll try it.
Unfortunately it didn't work. Despite how low the settings went.

KSP can't use your 12 gigs though, it's a 32bit program so is limited to about 3.5 but something else might be causing this.

Please upload your save file, [**dropbox**](dropbox.com) works well for this, also try adding KSP to your anti-virus whitelist so it's not being scanned while you play.

Here's the link to my save, I put it onto Dropbox. Yay. [https://www.dropbox.com/sh/sua5y43mqhg2ibd/AAD-6ZUqnFQKtpp4ckmMyiNha?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/sua5y43mqhg2ibd/AAD-6ZUqnFQKtpp4ckmMyiNha?dl=0)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-23T17:33:48Z" title="07/23/2015 05:33  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 23, 2015</time> by limeindy**

Hi, I previously posted the same issue. Adding to this thread because I have the same problem, and I am searching the forum for a solution. The game crashes when Revert to launch pad, or to KSC. I have made the recommended changes, and all the others in the forum.

 Have you found a solution yet? or has the issue disappeared? Please share. I have been grounded for weeks.

Thanks

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/6d3sehdwtqmp68a/AAA0JD_-Jj4w71NYFXrFD1v9a?dl=0[**https://www.dropbox.com/sh/6d3sehdwt...FXrFD1v9a?dl=0**](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/6d3sehdwt...FXrFD1v9a?dl=0)

There's many things that result in the same symptom, limeindy's appears to be specific to the craft but yours looks to be caused by something outside the game, so there's no "one size fits all" fix for this.

limeindy's best bet is to scrap the craft and build another as all his other craft are fine, as to why it's causing this I cannot tell, the output\_log just ends with no information and my player.log shows a segmentation fault when reverting with that particular craft.

> 
> Hi Spacejohn, I still don't know what's causing this yet, the error log only shows a general out-of-memory error and the output\_log doesn't say what caused the crash, usually the output\_log will say "system out of memory", but for you it just crashes.
> So there's no smoking gun here, which suggests the cause might be outside of the game and KSP can't do anything (except crash).
> 
> I'd like you to try starting your PC with a [**clean boot**](https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/kb/929135).
> 
> If KSP doesn't crash while in a clean environment it suggests there's a conflict with something else installed on your system.

I'm getting the exact same crash after 5-6 scene changes, no matter where to/from. High part count on scene seems to hasten it, as does how fast you go through the scene changes, but not much. It's a memory issue (access violation, just like above), but I have KSP nowhere near the limit (2.5 gigs or so), and the RAM also shows 0% usage. So not a case of excessive texture loading. I run an old Nvidia GT9800, I might try to force OpenGL to see if the problem is DX-related. My crash folder creation is about 5-6 logs a day... Some context out of a typical error log:

    mono.dll caused an Access Violation (0xc0000005)  in module mono.dll at 0023:10107259.Error occurred at 2015-07-28_020022.C:\Juegos\KSP\KSP_win\KSP.exe, run by Rune.71% memory in use.0 MB physical memory [2346 MB free].0 MB paging file [1948 MB free].0 MB user address space [61 MB free].Write to location 00000000 caused an access violation.

Glad to see it's a stock thing, though. I was considering nuking a lot of mods to see if I could make things better.

Rune. Let's cover a couple threads to see if I get some brilliant advice.
